com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job.operation

Class SynchronizableLongOperationImpl<Resource extends LongResource>

    public abstract class SynchronizableLongOperationImpl<Resource extends LongResource>
extends LongOperationImpl<Resource>
implements SynchronizableOperation<Resource>
    A LongOperationImpl that implements the SynchronizableOperation interface.

    • Method Detail

      • startSynchronization

        public void startSynchronization(OperationSynchronizer operationSynchronizer)
        Description copied from interface: SynchronizableOperation
        Call this method so that the current operation will adjust its allocated resource in order to finish (ie: to be completed) after running for at least the delay returned by OperationSynchronizer.getSynchronizationDelay().

        Calling this method will guarantee that this operation needs to be running for at least that delay before it becomes completed.
        But this method does not guarantee that the operation will be completed after it has been running for exactly that delay. If the operation gets a too low resource promise from its provisioner, then it may still need extra running time to be completed.

        If OperationSynchronizer.getSynchronizationDelay() returns a negative delay, then the current operation is delayed (i.e. will run forever).

        Additionally, after calling this method, and if OperationSynchronizer.isSynchronizeDelayBeforeCompletion() returns true, then current operation is delayed before completion. In such case, for the operation to resume, you need to pause the operation, call SynchronizableOperation.stopSynchronization() and resume it.

        Note: You should not need to call this method directly. If you need to synchronize an operation with an other, then use SynchronizableOperation.synchronizeWith(SynchronizableOperation) or OperationSynchronizer.addOperation(SynchronizableOperation).

        Specified by:
        startSynchronization in interface SynchronizableOperation<Resource extends LongResource>
        Parameters:
        operationSynchronizer - the operationSynchronizer
        See Also:
        SynchronizableOperation.startSynchronization(OperationSynchronizer)

      • stopSynchronization

        public void stopSynchronization()
        Description copied from interface: SynchronizableOperation
        Call this method to clear any synchronization restrictions that were set using SynchronizableOperation.startSynchronization(OperationSynchronizer).

        Note: You should not need to call this method directly. If you need to stop synchronizing an operation then use SynchronizableOperation.cancelSynchronization() or OperationSynchronizer.removeOperation(SynchronizableOperation).

        Specified by:
        stopSynchronization in interface SynchronizableOperation<Resource extends LongResource>
        See Also:
        SynchronizableOperation.stopSynchronization()

      • getOperationSynchronizer

        public OperationSynchronizer getOperationSynchronizer()
        Specified by:
        getOperationSynchronizer in interface SynchronizableOperation<Resource extends LongResource>
        See Also:
        SynchronizableOperation.getOperationSynchronizer()

      • synchronizeWith

        public void synchronizeWith(SynchronizableOperation<?> operation)
        Description copied from interface: SynchronizableOperation
        Synchronizes current operation with the given operation.

        This method will create an OperationSynchronizer and add both the current operation and the given operation to it.

        If current operation or the given operation is already synchronized then a new OperationSynchronizer is created, and all operations synchronized with either current operation or the given operation are added to the new OperationSynchronizer.

        Specified by:
        synchronizeWith in interface SynchronizableOperation<Resource extends LongResource>

      • cancelSynchronization

        public void cancelSynchronization()
        Description copied from interface: SynchronizableOperation
        Removes current operation from its OperationSynchronizer (see SynchronizableOperation.getOperationSynchronizer()).

        If current operation is not synchronized (has no defined OperationSynchronizer) then nothing is done.

        Specified by:
        cancelSynchronization in interface SynchronizableOperation<Resource extends LongResource>
